Methods

<static> repos.addCollaborator(msg, callback)

Parameters:
Name Type Description
msg Object

Object that contains the parameters and their values to be sent to the server.

Properties
Name Type Argument Description
headers Object <optional>

Key/ value pair of request headers to pass along with the HTTP request. Valid headers are: If-Modified-Since, If-None-Match, Cookie, User-Agent
user String
repo String
collabuser String
callback function

function to call when the request is finished with an error as first argument and result data as second argument.

<static> repos.compareCommits(msg, callback)

Parameters:
Name Type Description
msg Object

Object that contains the parameters and their values to be sent to the server.

Properties
Name Type Argument Description
headers Object <optional>

Key/ value pair of request headers to pass along with the HTTP request. Valid headers are: If-Modified-Since, If-None-Match, Cookie, User-Agent
user String
repo String
base String

Required string - The branch (or git ref) you want your changes pulled into. This should be an existing branch on the current repository. You cannot submit a pull request to one repo that requests a merge to a base of another repo.
head String

Required string - The branch (or git ref) where your changes are implemented.
callback function

function to call when the request is finished with an error as first argument and result data as second argument.
Source:
  • api/repos.js, line 660
Tutorials:
  • repos.compareCommits

<static> repos.create(msg, callback)

Parameters:
Name Type Description
msg Object

Object that contains the parameters and their values to be sent to the server.

Properties
Name Type Argument Description
headers Object <optional>

Key/ value pair of request headers to pass along with the HTTP request. Valid headers are: If-Modified-Since, If-None-Match, Cookie, User-Agent
name String
description String <optional>
homepage String <optional>
private Boolean <optional>

Optional boolean - true to create a private repository, false to create a public one. Creating private repositories requires a paid GitHub account. Default is false.
has_issues Boolean <optional>

Optional boolean - true to enable issues for this repository, false to disable them. Default is true.
has_wiki Boolean <optional>

Optional boolean - true to enable the wiki for this repository, false to disable it. Default is true.
has_downloads Boolean <optional>

Optional boolean - true to enable downloads for this repository, false to disable them. Default is true.
auto_init Boolean <optional>

Optional boolean - true to create an initial commit with empty README. Default is false
gitignore_template String <optional>

Optional string - Desired language or platform .gitignore template to apply. Ignored if auto_init parameter is not provided.
callback function

function to call when the request is finished with an error as first argument and result data as second argument.
Source:
  • api/repos.js, line 138
Tutorials:
  • repos.create

<static> repos.createCommitComment(msg, callback)

Parameters:
Name Type Description
msg Object

Object that contains the parameters and their values to be sent to the server.

Properties
Name Type Argument Description
headers Object <optional>

Key/ value pair of request headers to pass along with the HTTP request. Valid headers are: If-Modified-Since, If-None-Match, Cookie, User-Agent
user String
repo String
sha String
body String
commit_id String

Required string - Sha of the commit to comment on.
path String <optional>

Optional string - Relative path of the file to comment on.
position Number <optional>

Optional number - Line index in the diff to comment on.
line Number <optional>

Optional number - Line number in the file to comment on. Defaults to 1.
callback function

function to call when the request is finished with an error as first argument and result data as second argument.

<static> repos.createFromOrg(msg, callback)

Parameters:
Name Type Description
msg Object

Object that contains the parameters and their values to be sent to the server.

Properties
Name Type Argument Description
headers Object <optional>

Key/ value pair of request headers to pass along with the HTTP request. Valid headers are: If-Modified-Since, If-None-Match, Cookie, User-Agent
org String
name String
description String <optional>
homepage String <optional>
private Boolean <optional>

Optional boolean - true to create a private repository, false to create a public one. Creating private repositories requires a paid GitHub account. Default is false.
has_issues Boolean <optional>

Optional boolean - true to enable issues for this repository, false to disable them. Default is true.
has_wiki Boolean <optional>

Optional boolean - true to enable the wiki for this repository, false to disable it. Default is true.
has_downloads Boolean <optional>

Optional boolean - true to enable downloads for this repository, false to disable them. Default is true.
auto_init Boolean <optional>

Optional boolean - true to create an initial commit with empty README. Default is false
gitignore_template String <optional>

Optional string - Desired language or platform .gitignore template to apply. Ignored if auto_init parameter is not provided.
team_id Number <optional>

Optional number - The id of the team that will be granted access to this repository. This is only valid when creating a repo in an organization. Validation rule: ^[0-9]+$.
callback function

function to call when the request is finished with an error as first argument and result data as second argument.
Source:
  • api/repos.js, line 167
Tutorials:
  • repos.createFromOrg

<static> repos.createHook(msg, callback)

Parameters:
Name Type Description
msg Object

Object that contains the parameters and their values to be sent to the server.

Properties
Name Type Argument Description
headers Object <optional>

Key/ value pair of request headers to pass along with the HTTP request. Valid headers are: If-Modified-Since, If-None-Match, Cookie, User-Agent
user String
repo String
name String
config Json

Required hash - A Hash containing key/value pairs to provide settings for this hook. These settings vary between the services and are defined in the github-services repo. Booleans are stored internally as 1 for true, and 0 for false. Any JSON true/false values will be converted automatically.
events Array <optional>

Optional array - Determines what events the hook is triggered for. Default: ['push'].
active Boolean <optional>

Optional boolean - Determines whether the hook is actually triggered on pushes.
callback function

function to call when the request is finished with an error as first argument and result data as second argument.
Source:
  • api/repos.js, line 1280
Tutorials:
  • repos.createHook

<static> repos.getAll(msg, callback)

Parameters:
Name Type Description
msg Object

Object that contains the parameters and their values to be sent to the server.

Properties
Name Type Argument Description
headers Object <optional>

Key/ value pair of request headers to pass along with the HTTP request. Valid headers are: If-Modified-Since, If-None-Match, Cookie, User-Agent
type String <optional>

Possible values: all, owner, public, private, member. Default: all. Validation rule: ^(all|owner|public|private|member)$.
sort String <optional>

Possible values: created, updated, pushed, full_name. Default: full_name. Validation rule: ^(created|updated|pushed|full_name)$.
direction String <optional>

Validation rule: ^(asc|desc)$.
page Number <optional>

Page number of the results to fetch. Validation rule: ^[0-9]+$.
per_page Number <optional>

A custom page size up to 100. Default is 30. Validation rule: ^[0-9]+$.
callback function

function to call when the request is finished with an error as first argument and result data as second argument.
Source:
  • api/repos.js, line 65
Tutorials:
  • repos.getAll

<static> repos.getArchiveLink(msg, callback)

Parameters:
Name Type Description
msg Object

Object that contains the parameters and their values to be sent to the server.

Properties
Name Type Argument Description
headers Object <optional>

Key/ value pair of request headers to pass along with the HTTP request. Valid headers are: If-Modified-Since, If-None-Match, Cookie, User-Agent
user String
repo String
ref String

String of the name of the fully qualified reference (ie: heads/master). If it doesnt have at least one slash, it will be rejected.
archive_format String

Either tarball or zipball Validation rule: ^(tarball|zipball)$.
callback function

function to call when the request is finished with an error as first argument and result data as second argument.
Source:

<static> repos.getCommits(msg, callback)

Parameters:
Name Type Description
msg Object

Object that contains the parameters and their values to be sent to the server.

Properties
Name Type Argument Description
headers Object <optional>

Key/ value pair of request headers to pass along with the HTTP request. Valid headers are: If-Modified-Since, If-None-Match, Cookie, User-Agent
user String
repo String
sha String <optional>

Optional string - Sha or branch to start listing commits from.
path String <optional>

Optional string - Only commits containing this file path will be returned.
author String <optional>

Optional string - Only commits commited by this author.
page Number <optional>

Page number of the results to fetch. Validation rule: ^[0-9]+$.
per_page Number <optional>

A custom page size up to 100. Default is 30. Validation rule: ^[0-9]+$.
since Date <optional>

Optional string of a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ
until Date <optional>

Optional string of a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ
callback function

function to call when the request is finished with an error as first argument and result data as second argument.
Source:
  • api/repos.js, line 503
Tutorials:
  • repos.getCommits

<static> repos.getDownloads(msg, callback)

Parameters:
Name Type Description
msg Object

Object that contains the parameters and their values to be sent to the server.

Properties
Name Type Argument Description
headers Object <optional>

<static> repos.merge(msg, callback)

Parameters:
Name Type Description
msg Object

Object that contains the parameters and their values to be sent to the server.

Properties
Name Type Argument Description
headers Object <optional>

Key/ value pair of request headers to pass along with the HTTP request. Valid headers are: If-Modified-Since, If-None-Match, Cookie, User-Agent
user String
repo String
base String

Required string - The branch (or git ref) you want your changes pulled into. This should be an existing branch on the current repository. You cannot submit a pull request to one repo that requests a merge to a base of another repo.
head String

Required string - The branch (or git ref) where your changes are implemented.
commit_message String <optional>

Optional string - Commit message to use for the merge commit. If omitted, a default message will be used.
callback function

function to call when the request is finished with an error as first argument and result data as second argument.

<static> repos.update(msg, callback)

Parameters:
Name Type Description
msg Object

Object that contains the parameters and their values to be sent to the server.

Properties
Name Type Argument Description
headers Object <optional>

Key/ value pair of request headers to pass along with the HTTP request. Valid headers are: If-Modified-Since, If-None-Match, Cookie, User-Agent
user String
repo String
name String
description String <optional>
homepage String <optional>
private Boolean <optional>

Optional boolean - true to create a private repository, false to create a public one. Creating private repositories requires a paid GitHub account. Default is false.
has_issues Boolean <optional>

Optional boolean - true to enable issues for this repository, false to disable them. Default is true.
has_wiki Boolean <optional>

Optional boolean - true to enable the wiki for this repository, false to disable it. Default is true.
has_downloads Boolean <optional>

Optional boolean - true to enable downloads for this repository, false to disable them. Default is true.
callback function

function to call when the request is finished with an error as first argument and result data as second argument.

<static> repos.updateHook(msg, callback)

Parameters:
Name Type Description
msg Object

Object that contains the parameters and their values to be sent to the server.

Properties
Name Type Argument Description
headers Object <optional>

Key/ value pair of request headers to pass along with the HTTP request. Valid headers are: If-Modified-Since, If-None-Match, Cookie, User-Agent
user String
repo String
id String
name String
config Json

Required hash - A Hash containing key/value pairs to provide settings for this hook. Modifying this will replace the entire config object. These settings vary between the services and are defined in the github-services repo. Booleans are stored internally as 1 for true, and 0 for false. Any JSON true/false values will be converted automatically.
events Array <optional>

Optional array - Determines what events the hook is triggered for. This replaces the entire array of events. Default: ['push'].
add_events Array <optional>

Optional array - Determines a list of events to be added to the list of events that the Hook triggers for.
remove_events Array <optional>

Optional array - Determines a list of events to be removed from the list of events that the Hook triggers for.
active Boolean <optional>

Optional boolean - Determines whether the hook is actually triggered on pushes.
callback function

function to call when the request is finished with an error as first argument and result data as second argument.
Source:
  • api/repos.js, line 1307
Tutorials:
  • repos.updateHook
